questions.question_text: What is the PRIMARY reason for conducting a risk assessment when developing an annual IS audit plan?

choices.D: Decide which audit procedures and techniques to use
choices.B: Determine the existence of controls in audit areas
choices.C: Provide assurance material items will be covered

choices.B: Recommending controls to address the IT risks identified by KPIs
choices.D: Training the IT audit team on IT risk management processes
choices.A: Evaluating the effectiveness of IT risk management processes
choices.C: Developing KPIs to measure the internal audit team

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. - the question is about the greatest threat to its independence. The former - merely supporting - function in the development of the general KPIs of the organization is certainly the weaker threat to his independence than a current development of KPIs for the assessment of the internal audit team with his current, current activity as Lead Auditor, obviously within the same organization, i.e. his own team. In B.'s case, I see no compelling connection between his former support for the general organizational KPIs and the risk-related KPIs that are now recommended. If so, this should be specified more precisely in the question. This option is also weaker in the ranking compared to C.

comments.content: KPIs can be developed for different departments. These KPIs can have little to no connection to one another. Developing KPIs for your department has nothing to do with them developing KPIs for a separate department.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The auditor should not be involved in the design of controls. Proposing controls to address IT risks identified by KPIs would lead the auditor to control through KPIs of his own design, which would undermine auditor independence.

Selected Answer: B
The auditor should not be involved in the design of controls.

Selected Answer: C
The correct answer to this question is C. Developing KPIs to measure the internal audit team.

Independence is one of the most important qualities of an auditor, and it is essential to ensure that the auditor can carry out his or her responsibilities without any bias or undue influence. When an employee moves from one department to another, there is a potential risk that their previous role may influence their current role and create a conflict of interest. In this case, the employee helped develop the KPIs that are now being used by the organization, and these KPIs are being used to measure the effectiveness of the internal audit team. This means that the auditor may be evaluating their own work and performance, which could create a potential conflict of interest.

questions.question_text: After discussing findings with an auditee, an IS auditor is required to obtain approval of the report from the CEO before issuing it to the audit committee. This requirement PRIMARILY affects the IS auditor's:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Independence is a fundamental principle in auditing that ensures objectivity and impartiality in the audit process. When the CEO, who may have vested interests in the audit findings, has the authority to approve the report before it reaches the audit committee, it could potentially compromise the auditor's independence. The auditor might feel pressure to alter or suppress findings to align with the CEO's preferences, undermining the integrity of the audit process.

questions.question_text: During a review of IT service desk practices, an IS auditor notes that help desk personnel are spending more time fulfilling user requests for password resets than resolving critical incidents. Which of the following recommendations to IT management would BEST address this situation?

choices.C: Incentivize service desk personnel to close incidents within agreed service levels.
choices.B: Provide annual password management training to end users to reduce the number of instances requiring password resets.
choices.D: Implement a self-service solution and redirect users to access frequently requested services.
choices.A: Calculate the age of incident tickets and alert senior IT personnel when they exceed service level agreements (SLAs).

discussion.content: D. Implement a self-service solution and redirect users to access frequently requested services.
